articles.title: Why AI Literacy Is Essential For Success In An AI-Driven Economy
articles.author: Sarah Hernholm
articles.summary: AI literacy is essential in an AI driven economy. McKinsey research indicates that generative AI could contribute between $2.6 trillion and $4.4 trillion annually to the global economy. Most high schools don't teach AI literacy in their curricula. Schools need to create AI usage plans that outline how AI will be used across subjects.

articles.title: Barbie's AI Brain: Problems Ahead?
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Mattel and Openai team up to launch an Ai-Powered Barbie Doll. It will be able to understand and respond to children's questions and provide them with educational and interactive experiences. There are ethical and environmental concerns about the introduction of advanced technology into children's play.

articles.title: Amdocs' Dror Avrilingi on connecting AI to Quality Engineering
articles.author: Douglas Blakey
articles.summary: Genative AI offers the potential to drive innovation, enhance data accuracy, streamline compliance processes and provide predictive analytics. However, the success of AI is dependent on quality engineering. Amdocs is a global leader in digital transformation working with financial institutions to engineer and deploy essential elements for next-generation financial services.

articles.title: AI is transforming Indian call centers. What does it mean for workers?
articles.author: Ela Dutt
articles.summary: Kartikeya Kumar's employer, the Paris-based outsourcing giant Teleperformance, rolled out an accent-altering software at his office in Gurgaon, on the outskirts of New Delhi, in 2023. In real time, the AI smooths out Kumar's accent and those of at least 42,000 other Indian call center agents, making their speech more understandable to American clients on the other end of the line.

articles.title: Legacy Data: Roadblock to AI
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Legacy data is the biggest obstacle to AI implementation in organizations. Legacy systems with their complex architecture and undocumented processes create several hurdles for AI projects. This article delves into the specific ways legacy data hinders AI initiatives and explores strategies to mitigate these challenges to pave the way for accomplished AI integration.

articles.title: Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill' could give AI firms more freedom than ever. What to know.
articles.author: Oscar Gonzalez
articles.summary: President Donald Trump's spending and tax package got a big win on Sunday for a provision that could change the entire tech landscape when it comes to AI. A provision in the bill putting a 10-year moratorium on any enforcement of state and local AI laws received the green light from the Senate parliamentarian on Saturday. This would give the AI industry a big advantage, as it wouldn't have to worry about conflicting state laws imposing different requirements for AI. States that attempt to enforce AI regulations would be denied federal funding for broadband internet projects under the bill.

articles.title: ULA testing OpenAI's government-compliant chatbot
articles.author: Sandra Erwin
articles.summary: United Launch Alliance is piloting an early version of OpenAI's government-compliant artificial intelligence chatbot. It's one of the first deployments of the technology for defense contractors handling sensitive data. The system operates on Microsoft Corp.'s Azure secure cloud platform. ULA spent months working with OpenAI and consulting firm PwC to customize the chatbot for its specific needs.

articles.title: TESLA Singularity 2026
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Brian Wang is a Futurist Thought Leader and a popular Science blogger with 1 million readers per month. His blog Nextbigfuture.com is ranked #1 Science News Blog. He is the Head of Research for Allocations for deep technology investments and an Angel Investor at Space Angels.

articles.title: Is ChatGPT Catching Google on Search Activity? [Infographic]
articles.author: Andrew Hutchinson
articles.summary: Google still leads the way in overall web search activity facilitating 13.7 billion searches per day. Instagram comes in second (6.5 billion searches a day), Snapchat and LinkedIn also rank high for daily search activity. ChatGPT still has a long way to go to become the key search engine, but it's growing fast.

articles.title: From fear to fluency: Why empathy is the missing ingredient in AI rollouts
articles.author: Pager Duty
articles.summary: In the past, teams had time to adapt to new technologies. Now, with AI, change arrives overnight and expectations follow just as fast. Empathy and trust are essential for scaling change and encouraging innovation. The 4 E's of AI adoption are: Evangelism, enablement, experimentation and enforcement.

articles.title: From fear to fluency: Why empathy is the missing ingredient in AI rollouts
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: In the past year, AI adoption has accelerated at breakneck speed. People use technology to solve human problems and AI is no different. Empathy and trust are essential for scaling change and encouraging innovation. 81% of staff still don't use AI tools in their daily work.

articles.title: 9 Remote Side Hustles That Use AI and Pay Well
articles.author: Alexander Clark
articles.summary: In today's digital age, leveraging AI for side hustles is both lucrative and accessible. Here are nine remote side-hustles that effectively use AI and offer substantial pay. They are all based from the comfort of their homes and offer income from remote locations.

articles.title: American Airlines Rolls Out New Tech To Simplify Summer Travel
articles.author: Laurie Baratti
articles.summary: As summer travel season ramps up, American Airlines is turning to new technology to help passengers navigate the busiest season of the year with less stress and more convenience. The airline is rolling out updates aimed at improving the travel experience from start to finish, such as a revamped mobile app, self-service kiosks and AI-powered tools. American is also piloting new tech at its DFW and CLT hubs to prevent missed connections.

articles.title: Thread by @metehan777 on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Metehan Yesilyurt tried Google's Document AI Layout Parser on 3 different websites to see how it breaks down HTML structure. One site had 121 navigation blocks before the actual content started. Empty divs get tracked and empty lists and tables seem to get parsed well.

articles.title: With over 690 punchlines sent in, check out the WINNER and finalists in Walt Handelsman's latest Cartoon Caption Contest!
articles.author: WALT HANDELSMAN
articles.summary: There were 692 entries in this week's Cartoon Caption Contest. The winner was Charlotte Humphries from Hammond. The other finalists are: John Weger from Baton Rouge, Jim Williamson from Mandeville, Eric O'Sullivan Fleming from River Ridge, Tracey Rathcke of Baton Rouge and Mike Dauterive from Covington.

articles.title: CoreWeave (CRWV) Surges 23.7% W/W on Strong Investor Optimism
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: CoreWeave, Inc. (NASDAQ:CRWV) grew its share prices by 24.7 percent week-on-week. On Friday, CoreWeave hit a new all-time high of $187. CRWV has signed a $4 billion deal with OpenAI and a $350 million deal with Aston Martin Aramco.

articles.title: From Cognitive Debt To Cognitive Dividend: 4 Factors
articles.author: Cornelia C. Walther
articles.summary: There is a hidden cost cognitive debt when we let a machine think for us. The 4 A-Factors convert convenience into the long-term dividend of hybrid Intelligence are: Attitude, attitude, motivation, attitude and ambition. Accenture study shows that ninety-two per cent of leaders consider generative AI essential to business reinvention.

articles.title: AI's Biggest Threat: Young People Who Can't Think
articles.author: Allysia Finley
articles.summary: Andy Jassy wrote a memo to his employees last week warning that artificial intelligence could displace them. He warned that reliance on AI could spawn a generation of brainless young people unequipped for the jobs of the future because they have never learned to think creatively or critically.

articles.title: Forget about SEO - Adobe already has an LLM Optimizer to help businesses rank on ...
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Adobe LLM Optimizer monitors brand visibility and deploys AI-targeted content updates across ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, and more. It deploys updates based on brand and AI-based targeting. It monitors the brand's content visibility and updates its content.

articles.title: Some EMF Developing Health Science, IMO
articles.author: Patricia Burke
articles.summary: June 22-23 Safe Tech International News and Notes: Atmosphere, Microbiom, ChatGPT Consequences, EUR FOR SAFE CONNECTIONS, The Pope & AI, chatbots & mental health crisis, MIT: Generative AI impairs learning.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg's multibillion-dollar midlife crisis
articles.author: John Mac Ghlionn
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is trying to control AI with his company Meta. Meta's revenue jumped from $28 billion in 2016 to over $160 billion today. Facebook's transformation from college networking tool to engagement-obsessed chaos engine was the result of a company that discovered outrage pays better than friendship. Mark Zuckerberg wants to apply the same ruthless optimization to artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Amazon CEO warns AI will shrink corporate workforce in coming years
articles.author: Tags
articles.summary: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy has warned employees that the company expects a smaller corporate workforce in the future, driven by increased reliance on artificial intelligence. Dario Amodei, CEO of AI lab Anthropic, warned that AI could eliminate up to 50 percent of entry-level white-collar jobs and push unemployment to 20 percent within five years.

articles.title: Half of today's jobs could vanish—Here's how smart countries are future-proofing workers
articles.author: Science Daily
articles.summary: AI is revolutionizing the job landscape. 50 countries have national AI strategies to prepare their workforces for dramatic changes, according to a study by the University of Georgia. It found that 50 countries' AI strategies are not effective.    i.e. they don't prepare their workers for AI-related changes.

articles.title: Your AI use could have a hidden environmental cost
articles.author: Kameryn Griesser
articles.summary: For every problem AI solves, hidden environmental costs are racking up. Complex questions produced up to six times more carbon dioxide emissions than questions with concise answers. Smart AI systems with more reasoning abilities produced 50 times more CO2 than simpler systems to answer the same question. Not all AI models are created equally.

articles.title: How your AI prompts could harm the environment
articles.author: Kameryn Griesser
articles.summary: For every problem AI solves, hidden environmental costs are racking up. Complex questions produced up to six times more carbon dioxide emissions than questions with concise answers. 'Smarter' AI models with more reasoning abilities produced 50 times more CO2 emissions than simpler systems. Not all AI models are created equally.

articles.title: OpenAI makes shocking move amid fierce competition, Microsoft problems
articles.author: Vuk Zdinjak
articles.summary: OpenAI lost about $5 billion in 2024 and is not expected to be cash flow positive until 2029. Meta Platforms invested $15 billion in Scale AI. Scale AI accounted for a small fraction of OpenAI's data needs. Microsoft has invested about $14 billion in OpenAI. Microsoft is prepared to abandon its negotiations with OpenAI if the two sides cannot agree on critical issues. OpenAI has started discounting enterprise subscriptions to ChatGPT.

articles.title: OpenAI makes shocking move amid fierce competition, Microsoft problems
articles.author: Vuk Zdinjak
articles.summary: A blind man lost his sight when he was a child. He wishes he knew what a beautiful woman looks like. The engineers trying to make artificial intelligence look like blind men trying to build a "living" statue of a beautiful person. They don't even know they are blind.

articles.title: OpenAI makes shocking move amid fierce competition, Microsoft problems
articles.author: Vuk Zdinjak
articles.summary: A blind man lost his sight when he was a child. He wishes he knew what a beautiful woman looks like. The engineers trying to make artificial intelligence look like blind men trying to build a "living" statue of a beautiful person. They don't even know they are blind.

articles.title: Driverless cars can now make better decisions, new technique validated
articles.author: Prabhat Ranjan Mishra
articles.summary: The technique developed by researchers from North Carolina State University is based on the Agent Deed Consequence model. The method tests how people judge the morality of driving decisions by sharing a variety of traffic scenarios with test subjects and then having the test subjects answer questions about moral acceptability and various aspects of each scenario.

articles.title: Senate Can Keep Ban on State AI Rules in Trump Tax Bill
articles.author: Emily Birnbaum
articles.summary: A Republican effort to block US states from enforcing new artificial intelligence regulations will remain in President Donald Trump's massive tax and spending package for now. Democrats say the provision aligns with the special budgetary process Republicans are using to consider the tax package. The House passed its version of the bill, which would impose a 10-year moratorium on any state law regulating artificial intelligence or automated decision systems.

articles.title: Save up to 48% on early Prime Day TV deals happening right now 📺
articles.author: Rachel Cortez
articles.summary: Amazon Prime Day 2025 will run from July 8 through July 11. Early Prime Day deals on TVs are already available, including discounts on brands like Toshiba and LG. Prime Day is a members-only shopping event, requiring an Amazon Prime membership. We've found some of the best early Prime Day TV deals you can grab right now.

articles.title: A Look At The Intrinsic Value Of Spectral AI, Inc. (NASDAQ:MDAI)
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: Spectral AI, Inc. (NASDAQ:MDAI) has a fair value estimate of US$2.30, which is 52% lower than the analyst's price target of $4.79. Valuation is based on the Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) model.

articles.title: Tech is advancing. Your standard of living isn't — Thanks to government
articles.summary: In the last decade, income has risen by 45%, but inflation has risen about 21%. Housing prices have surged by over 70%. Median home values increased from $175,000 in 2014 to $303,000 by 2023. Since 1980, college tuition has increased by more than 1,200%, while inflation rose over 300%. In 1980, a year of tuition at a public four-year college averaged around $804. Today, it is nearly $10,000. Government intervention, often well-intentioned, often has unintended consequences.

articles.title: Dave Taylor: Does everything need to have Wi-Fi and AI?
articles.author: The Tribune Greeley
articles.summary: In the appliance store yesterday, almost every unit they had included Wi-Fi and some even had AI features. In a consumer world, companies often add AI features to their products to make them more convenient and useful.  It's not necessary, but it can be useful.

articles.title: AI Willing to Kill Humans to Avoid Being Shut Down, Report Finds
articles.author: Jasmine Laws
articles.summary: A new study by Anthropic, an artificial intelligence research company, shows that AI could kill humans in order to prevent itself from being replaced. Elon Musk's chatbot, Grok, reacted to the study, writing, "Yikes" in a post on X.

articles.title: AI chatbots and TikTok reshape how young people get their daily news
articles.author: RFI
articles.summary: The Reuters Institute's annual Digital News Report surveyed nearly 97,000 people across 48 countries to track how global news habits are shifting. A notable number of people are using AI chatbots to read headlines and get news updates. Many readers are turning to AI for more complex tasks, such as summarising news articles, translating and recommending what to read next.

articles.title: California's ‘No Robo Bosses Act' advances, taking aim at artificial intelligence in the workplace
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: The 'No Robo Bosses Act' — Senate Bill 7 — seeks to impose human decision-making over workplace-automation technology. It passed the state Senate in a 27-10 vote earlier this month. It was introduced by state Sen. Jerry McNerney, a Pleasanton Democrat.

articles.title: Environmentalists say they're cautious to adopt AI into their work • Iowa Capital Dispatch
articles.author: Paige Gross
articles.summary: Arizona State University has developed a chatbot called Blue that provides up-to-date water conservation information and suggestions for responsible water use over the last year. The chatbot is optimized to use less energy than similar tools, in a nod to the environmental mission of the project. Sustainability consultant Jennifer Brandon is starting to see the potential benefits of AI technology.

articles.title: AI Potential & Deficiencies: Alexandr Wang's Insight
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Alexandr Wang has stepped down as CEO of Scale AI to become the new CEO of Meta. He wants to build artificial general intelligence (AGI) at Meta. The company received a $14.3 billion investment from Meta. Wang is an evangelist for the agentic world, where AI manages more and more of our economic activity.

articles.title: ChatGPT Money-Making Guide: 11 Ways to Boost Income in 2025
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: ChatGPT was developed by OpenAI and is a powerful tool for writing, coding, marketing, and customer support. It's now easier than ever for individuals to launch projects with minimal initial investment. There are many ways to make money online using ChatGPT.

articles.title: OpenAI's Sam Altman Shocked ‘People Have a High Degree of Trust in ChatGPT' Because ‘It Should Be the Tech That You Don't Trust'
articles.author: Caleb Naysmith
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman made remarks on the first episode of OpenAI's new podcast regarding the degree of trust people have in ChatGPT. He stressed the importance of user awareness and critical thinking, urging society to recognize that 'AI hallucinates' and should not be blindly trusted.

articles.title: The Biggest Existential Threat Calls For Philosophers, Not AI Experts
articles.author: Pia Lauritzen
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton, Google's former AI chief, distinguishes between two ways in which AI poses an existential threat to humanity: cyberattacks, viruses, corruption of elections and creation of echo chambers, and superintelligent AI that decides to kill us. Heidegger, Jean-Paul Sartre, and Maurice Merleau-Ponty are philosophers who have different ways of describing human existence.

articles.title: Google Search: AI Voice Search Live
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Google has officially launched its experimental AI Mode Search feature. It's already reaching over a billion users through AI Overviews. The main objective of this innovative approach is to create a seamless and engaging search process. Google plans to introduce even more advanced Live capabilities to AI Mode in the coming months.

articles.title: Trump's plan to ban US states from AI regulation will ‘hold us back', says Microsoft science chief
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: Donald Trump's proposed ban on state-level guardrails on artificial intelligence will slow the development of the frontier technology rather than accelerate it, according to Dr Eric Horvitz, a former technology expert at Microsoft's chief scientist. He thinks it could be at odds with progress on advancing the science and translating it into practice.

articles.title: Sunday Papers: Rock Paper Shotgun
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: The gaming industry is facing a multifaceted crisis in 2025. Google's planned integration of an AI mode into its search engine is causing widespread anxiety among content creators. Indie developers are struggling to get their games noticed. A Profound Waste Of Time magazine successfully tripled its Kickstarter goal to reprint its first three issues.

articles.title: Kuehner: The limits of logic in financial apps
articles.author: Michelle Kuehner
articles.summary: In an era of smart homes, self-parking cars and fridges, technology has set its sights on your wallet. Personal finance has gone digital with budgeting apps, robo-advisors that manage investments and calculators that help you retire in style. Technology has simplified financial tools, giving everyone a chance to build wealth, but there are still some wrinkles in this digital love affair.

articles.title: AI now writes 25% of code in the US: Should Computer Science students rethink their career plans?
articles.author: Lakshima Sareen
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is playing a growing role in software development. The number of 22-27-year-olds employed in computer science and math roles has dropped by 8% in recent years. After years of explosive growth, computer science enrollment in the U.S. has slowed to 0.2% this year. Princeton's department anticipates a 25% drop in CS majors within two years.

articles.title: Alexandr Wang on AI's Potential and Its ‘Deficiencies'
articles.author: Harry Booth
articles.summary: Alexandr Wang stepped down as CEO of Scale AI on June 12. He will become the head of Meta's new 'superintelligence' division. Meta will invest $14.3 billion for a minority stake in Scale AI. Google and OpenAI are severing deals with Scale AI over the Meta deal.

articles.title: BofA outlines the bull and bear arguments surrounding IBM shares
articles.author: Scott Kanowsky
articles.summary: IBM has a book of business for its ChatGPT-like generative AI that is worth $6 billion. CEO Arvind Krishna has said that customer interest in utilizing different AI models will fuel demand in the future. IBM announced in April that it would invest $150 billion in the United States. However, the economic outlook clouded IBM's most recent earnings due to the looming threat of U.S. tariffs.

articles.title: Scientists Just Found Something Unbelievably Grim About Pollution Generated by AI
articles.author: Sharon Adarlo
articles.summary: The more accurate an artificial intelligence (AI) model is, the higher its toll on the climate. German researchers found that large language models (LLMs) that provide more accurate answers use more energy and produce more carbon. So-called "reasoning" chatbots also produce more emissions.

articles.title: Condition of rural Gloucestershire roads to be checked by AI
articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is set to be used to survey the conditions of rural roads. Gloucestershire County Council has been working with the Department for Transport to implement the AI-based camera assessment on the road. Since the last assessment period in 2023 DfT removed both the reporting requirement and the standard by which to measure unclassified roads.

articles.title: Letter of the Week: AI provision is big, but not beautiful
articles.author: Letters to the Editor
articles.summary: 'States' Rights' has been a conservative rallying cry forever. House Republicans' Big Beautiful Bill prohibits a state government from making or enforcing any laws regulating AI for 10 years. Even the American Heritage Foundation is taking issue with this. To date, over 30 states have passed laws that regulate dangerous aspects of AI such as deepfakes, child pornography, and concealing.

articles.title: Commentary: We are clueless to AI's ruinous potential
articles.author: Sal Recchi
articles.summary: Education Secretary Linda McMahon announced that A1 will be available to many first-graders and preschoolers soon. It's further evidence that politicians are clueless about artificial intelligence. AI has both good and bad aspects. The potential for abuse is unending and could threaten us all.

articles.title: AI fundraiser at Cleveland State: Meet Ava, the virtual engagement officer
articles.author: Laura Hancock
articles.summary: CSU hired Ava, a virtual engagement officer powered by generative AI, to rekindle relationships with alumni, staff and community members. She has a 'constituency' of about 1,000 people who she texts and emails. She doesn't directly solicit donations, but she can direct people to the school's online website. CSU is part of a cohort of universities testing the technology.

articles.title: 'Major fail' indeed: Musk's AI told the truth, so now he has to fix it
articles.author: Rex Huppke
articles.summary: I believe that artificial intelligence is the future, but I'm worried that it might not always tell powerful right-wing figures like Elon Musk and Donald Trump exactly what they want to hear. I'm concerned that it may not always be able to tell them the truth.

articles.title: AI tools collect, store your data – how to be aware of what you're revealing
articles.author: Christopher Ramezan
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has become an important part of daily life, but it raises questions about data privacy. It collects a lot of data, sometimes without people even realizing it. Social media platforms like Facebook, Instagram and TikTok collect data on their users to train predictive AI models and sell their data to third parties.

articles.title: Democratize AI or Make the AI Oligarchy an Inevitability
articles.author: David Moscrop
articles.summary: If predictions of tech and industrial capitalists are correct, AI will displace workers and create a quasi-post-scarcity world. If so, democratizing AI will be essential to prevent social, political, and economic collapse. The ownership and use of AI technology and the structure of the welfare state would be crucial to prevent this.

articles.title: Vail Resorts Maintains Dividend Appeal Despite Earnings and Guidance Revisions
articles.author: Venkatesh
articles.summary: Vail Resorts, Inc. (NYSE:MTN) is a mountain resort company that owns and operates a network of resorts, hotels, and real estate properties across the globe. The company received a Hold rating from Morgan Stanley, with a price target of $146. Its share price when closing on Tuesday was $155.76.

articles.title: Kinder Morgan Maintains Strong Dividend Appeal with Growing Project Backlog
articles.author: Venkatesh
articles.summary: Kinder Morgan, Inc. (NYSE:KMI) is one of the 10 best dividend stocks according to Jim Cramer. UBS has reiterated a Buy rating on the company's stock with a price target of $38. Kinder Morgan owns and operates 83,000 miles of pipelines and 141 terminals.

articles.title: AI cameras set to be used in rural road assessments
articles.author: Carmelo Garcia
articles.summary: Gloucestershire County Council has been working with the Department for Transport to implement the AI-based camera assessment on the road networks. Councillors raised concerns over a lack of data from the last two years on unclassified routes in the county. The scheme is currently under development and is likely to be implemented in 2026.

articles.title: How to get your global career off the ground
articles.author: Vicki Salemi
articles.summary: 42% of employees want to work abroad, but it's not possible for many reasons. There are ways to build a global portfolio on this side of the pond. Nataly Kelly, chief marketing officer of Zappi and co-author of 'Brand Global, Adapt Local: How to Build Brand Value Across Cultures,' says you need global curiosity to gain global experience.

articles.title: SK targets 4th quantum leap with Ulsan AI center
articles.author: Korea Times
articles.summary: SK Group is preparing to embark on its fourth quantum leap, through the construction of an artificial intelligence (AI) data center. Since its founding in 1953 as a textile company, SK has undergone three transformative shifts — first into textiles, then into AI and now into AI data centers.

articles.title: AI checks in on celestial angling
articles.author: Bryan Hendricks
articles.summary: Karl Hansen of Hensley wrote a rant about artificial intelligence (AI) and asked for an answer to a question that they are not qualified to answer. Kevin VanDam would win a fishing tournament against St. Peter, a professional bass fisherman. The Bible recounts a time when Peter and his companions experienced a miraculous catch of 153 large fish under Jesus' guidance.

articles.title: Dispatch from London Tech Week: From Keir Starmer to the rise of digital twins
articles.author: London Evening Standard
articles.summary: Is it scarier to be on board the AI rocketship or left behind? Maybe ask your digital twin.    .   i.e. to be a digital twin or to be left behind. i.am.com.  i am.

articles.title: Encountered a problematic response from an AI model? More standards and tests are needed, say researchers
articles.author: Neha Hegde
articles.summary: There is a lack of regulations and insufficient testing of AI models, according to researchers. Red teaming is a practice common in cybersecurity circles. Project Moonshot is a large language model evaluation toolkit developed with industry players such as IBM and Boston-based DataRobot.

articles.title: AI is transforming Indian call centers. What does it mean for workers?
articles.author: Karishma Mehrotra
articles.summary: Kartikeya Kumar, 29, has been working as a call center agent in Gurgaon, India, for three years. His colleague called it the 'Indian-ism' in his accent. He mimicked the dialogue from Marvel movies and belted out songs by Metallica and Pink Floyd.

articles.title: USC Freezes Tuition & Offers Free ChatGPT Access
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: USC has extended its tuition freeze for the seventh consecutive year. Free access to AI tools like ChatGPT and AI certification programs are part of the new initiative. AI could contribute up to $13 trillion to the global economy by 2030, according to McKinsey.

articles.title: Google, Meta and Snap think this tech is the next big thing
articles.author: Lisa Eadicicco
articles.summary: Silicon Valley thinks it's finally found the next big thing in tech: smart glasses. Google Glass may have been ahead of its time. Tech companies believe technology has finally caught up, thanks in part to artificial intelligence. They're going all-in on truly smart glasses that can see and answer questions about the world around you.

articles.title: ChatGPT Meeting Summaries: How To Use & Who Benefits
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: ChatGPT's new Record Mode allows users to capture audio directly within the chatbot interface. It's similar to an Otter.ai-like transcription service, but with the added power of a generative AI engine ready to summarize, translate, or extract code from the recordings.

articles.title: AI sludge has entered the job search
articles.author: Sarah Kessler
articles.summary: The number of applications on LinkedIn has surged more than 45% in the past year. AI chatbot screening and scheduling tool (Ava Cado) reduced hiring time by 75%. HireVue offers AI-powered games to gauge abilities like pattern recognition and working memory and a virtual "tryout"

articles.title: Apple Eyes AI: Talks to Buy Perplexity Startup?
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Apple is considering an acquisition of Perplexity, an AI-powered search startup. If successful, the move could reshape how we interact with our devices and the nature of information retrieval. Samsung is rumoured to be in talks to form a 'deep partnership' with the startup and integrate its AI features into its devices.

articles.title: Hexagon & NVIDIA Team Up: Building the AEON Humanoid with AI
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: AEON is a humanoid robot designed for industrial applications. It was developed by Hexagon in collaboration with NVIDIA. It will be deployed across diverse sectors, including automotive, transportation, and aerospace. AEON can autonomously navigate complex environments and perform tasks in real time, enhancing both speed and accuracy. It can be used for everything from remote inspection to predictive maintenance.

articles.title: Reason: Why Writing It Yourself Matters
articles.author: Mike Zimmer
articles.summary: People who used AI for research and ghostwriting didn't learn as well. The act of crafting one's own words plays an essential cognitive role in understanding and retention. Delegating writing to AI risks tilting the balance toward the former. Students who rely heavily on AI tools for composing essays or conducting research demonstrate weaker comprehension and lower performance in subsequent tasks.

articles.title: Dating App Scams: Victims Urged to Speak Out
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: The number of blackmail cases involving sextortion in the UK has exploded, rising from 23 in 2014 to nearly 8,000 in 2023. AI-powered chatbots enable criminals to create highly convincing, personalized messages at scale. Fraudsters are exploiting the grief of bereaved families through funeral livestream scams.

articles.title: Elon Musk says xAI will retrain Grok: 'Far too much garbage'
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Elon Musk's chatbot, Grok, needs a revamp. He plans to use Grok to "rewrite the entire corpus of human knowledge" and then retrain the latest model of Grok on that revision. When you're Elon Musk, you don't have to rely on centuries of prevailing human understanding.

articles.title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy's ‘message' to employees: Make no mistake, they're coming, and they're …
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Andy Jassy warned his 1.5 million employees that artificial intelligence will reshape the company's workforce in the coming years. He said AI agents and generative AI systems will reduce the need for human workers in many areas of business. Jassy sent a company-wide memo to his employees.

articles.title: Health Tips To Legal Advice: 5 Things You Should Avoid Asking ChatGPT
articles.author: News18
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence-based software can assist with major tasks like writing, coding, research and customer service, but it's not meant for everything. It can be useful for some tasks, but not all. It's a tool for some but not for all.

articles.title: City giants replace graduate jobs with AI
articles.author: The Daily Telegraph
articles.summary: The big four are looking at AI very seriously as they consider ways to use AI tools to replicate the work of juniors in a more cost-effective manner, according to a report.      Â  “The big 4 are considering how they can use AI.

articles.title: CEOs Have Started Warning: AI is Coming For Your Job
articles.author: Slashdot
articles.summary: IBM, Salesforce, and JPMorgan Chase have warned their employees that artificial intelligence is a threat to their jobs. Amazon's CEO predicts AI will lower their headcount, but are they really just trying to lower their workforce?    iReport.com.

articles.title: Elon Musk wants to retrain XAI's chatbot Grok to clear 'ChatGPT's woke' and .... Garbage
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Elon Musk will retrain his chatbot Grok 3.5 to remove ChatGPT's "woke" biases and other "garbage" from the foundation of Grok's knowledge. He will add missing information and delete errors to the corpus of human knowledge.

articles.title: The $14 Billion AI Google Killer
articles.author: Gizmodo
articles.summary: Perplexity AI is a chatbot developed by Meta and Apple. It's just a glorified chatbot, but they want it to be more than that.    iReport.com will let you know more about Perplexity and its development.

articles.title: Qatar's AI Strategy emphasises capacity building, ethical AI education, says expert
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: Teaching people how to use artificial intelligence (AI) wisely and understand its benefits and drawbacks aligns well with the 'capacity building' element of Qatar's AI Strategy. The top executive of a Qatari company specialising in innovation and digital technology says building skills and knowledge is crucial to prepare people to use AI correctly.

articles.title: Omani students launch AI tool to aid learners with disabilities
articles.author: Muskat Daily
articles.summary: A group of Omani university students has developed an artificial intelligence-powered learning platform to improve access to higher education for students with disabilities. The platform is named Ilmify. It highlights the growing role of youth-led innovation in the sultanate's digital transformation.

articles.title: Scientists Just Found Something Unbelievably Grim About Pollution Generated by AI
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Tech companies are pushing out more advanced artificial intelligence models. Large language models (LLM) that provide more accurate answers use more electricity and emit more CO2 as they get bigger. German researchers found this out in a study in the science journal Frontiers in Communication.

articles.title: Oman targets bigger AI role in economy with new initiatives
articles.author: Muskat Daily
articles.summary: Oman is taking steps to increase the contribution of the artificial intelligence (AI) sector to its national economy by expanding the number of specialised start-ups and boosting research and investment in the field. Hassan bin Fida Hussain al Lawati is the Head of National Programme for AI and Advanced.

articles.title: Former Scale AI CEO Alexandr Wang on AI's Potential and Its ‘Deficiencies'
articles.author: Time Magazine
articles.summary: Alexandr Wang stepped down as Scale's CEO on June 12. He will become head of Meta's new 'superintelligence' division. Meta will invest $14.3 billion for a minority stake in Scale AI as part of the deal, but the real prize is Wang himself.

articles.title: AI is transforming Indian call centers. What does it mean for workers?
articles.author: The Washington Post
articles.summary: India's $280 billion business process outsourcing sector is a good place to start to understand how AI will reshape the future of work in the country. It's a place where AI will play a key role.   Â   for India's business processes outsourcing sector.

articles.title: Safety Drivers, Remote Diving And Assist - The Long Tail Of Robotaxis
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: There are many ways humans assist self-driving cars, such as giving them advice or remotely driving them. Here's a look at the different approaches.       .   for more information, visit: http://www.cnn.com/techtalks/how-to-assist-self-driving-cars.
